SEARCH
Package librarySE.repo

Interface ItemRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileItemRepository
public interface ItemRepository
Defines the contract for managing persistence operations of LibraryItem objects.

This interface abstracts how library items (such as books, CDs, and journals) are stored and retrieved from persistent storage (e.g., JSON files, databases, etc.).

Typical implementations include:

  • FileItemRepository – stores items in a JSON file.
  • DatabaseItemRepository – stores items in a database (future expansion).

Responsibilities:

  • Load all library items currently stored in the system.
  • Persist updates to items such as new additions or modifications.

Usage Example:


 ItemRepository repo = new FileItemRepository();
 List<LibraryItem> items = repo.loadAll();
 items.add(new Book("123", "Clean Code", "Robert C. Martin"));
 repo.saveAll(items);
Author:
Malak

    Method

    loadAll()
    Loads all LibraryItem objects from persistent storage.
    void

  • Method Details

    • loadAll

      List<LibraryItem> loadAll()
      Loads all LibraryItem objects from persistent storage.
      Returns:
      a list of all stored library items; never null, but may be empty

    • saveAll

      void saveAll(List<LibraryItem> items)
      Saves the given list of LibraryItem objects to persistent storage.

      This operation typically overwrites the existing data with the provided list.

      Parameters:
      items - the list of library items to save; must not be null
